TopicTitle: Throttle control seems sluggish as of v. 0.23

Articles.Content:
This is simply an observation; so far I've not encountered a situation where this becomes fatal. Question: is this a "feature or a bug"?

I posted this in case others have noticed the same behavior. Thanks.

Helpful info: sandbox mode, running on a Mac.

Edited December 18, 2013 by Dispatcher
I have noticed the dame behavior, I think this is a feature in that it smooths throttle control and slows it down so that you can get more realistic control. (I'm on Windows 7)

I think it's meant to give more throttle control as taki117 said. A bit of a pain in some situations as I had to get used to giving myself about 2-3 extra seconds to throttle up, but at the same time it makes it easier to say, smooth your decent speed during landing.

I saw it too, and I'm also running on a Mac (Macbook Pro)- though take a look at the game time clock in the upper left. I got the slow throttle when all other controls seemed to be behaving perfectly, but the game clock was running about 1 second for every 1-3 real-time seconds. It might be a new way lag manifests itself with the update in unity: Camera seems unaffected but simulation slowed a little.

Your mileage may vary.
